sourcing.instructions: Cobalt (Co) from metal suppliers, Phosphorus (P) from chemical supply companies, Ruthenium (Ru) from precious metal dealers, Scandium (Sc) from specialty metal suppliers, Thulium (Tm) from rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Cobalt (Co) from metal suppliers, Phosphorus (P) from chemical supply companies, Ruthenium (Ru) from precious metal dealers, Scandium (Sc) from specialty metal suppliers, Thulium (Tm) from rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Co, P, Ru, Sc, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Co, P, Ru, Sc, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to a temperature of 1200째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for a duration of 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogenization of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to a temperature of 1200째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for a duration of 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogenization of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Ensure the furnace is not opened until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Ensure the furnace is not opened until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. If required, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. If required, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability.
